content: You do not “consume creativity”, and that kind of business lingo mentality is so much of what is wrong with today’s self-proclaimed “creators”. But you have an important point about craftsmanship. Being an artist is part craftsmanship, part creativity. The craftsmanship part is what takes practice, sweat and tears (and varying amounts of it — yes it comes easier for some. If you ever studied alongside a tone-deaf person who wanted to learn music, you know). Any human has a life full of experiences to communicate. Artist souls aren’t any deeper than anyone else’s — so when you pick someone to listen to, it’s their craftsmanship that should decide, not their supposed “creative genius”.
